body: Why is `WriteReply` not tested?

`WriteReply` creates and triggers a `HTTPEvent` which I didn't want in a unit test :)

More generally: some decoupling from `libevent` wouldn't hurt in `HTTPRequest`. For example, notice that `HTTPRequest::~HTTPRequest` calls `WriteReply(â¦)` (by default) :)
style-nit: Could add a newline after `:` to save some whitespace
diff_hunk:
@@ -510,8 +510,8 @@ void HTTPEvent::trigger(struct timeval* tv)
     else
         evtimer_add(ev, tv); // trigger after timeval passed
 }
-HTTPRequest::HTTPRequest(struct evhttp_request* _req) : req(_req),
-                                                       replySent(false)
+HTTPRequest::HTTPRequest(struct evhttp_request* _req, bool _replySent) : req(_req),
+                                                                         replySent(_replySent)

body: FWIW: The H2O repo has a very good HTTP/1.1 seed corpus which can be used to seed this fuzzer: https://github.com/h2o/h2o/tree/master/fuzz
Fixed in a way that `clang-format` appreciates :)

body: I like to put each member in a separate line so that adding or removing one is less likely to conflict with other related changes, but no biggie

body:
I already knows it, you just have to add the newlines manually:

```
$ git diff && (git diff|cfd) && git diff 
diff --git a/src/httpserver.cpp b/src/httpserver.cpp
index 7282b517f4..3b2e644319 100644
--- a/src/httpserver.cpp
+++ b/src/httpserver.cpp
@@ -510,7 +510,9 @@ void HTTPEvent::trigger(struct timeval* tv)
     else
         evtimer_add(ev, tv); // trigger after timeval passed
 }
-HTTPRequest::HTTPRequest(struct evhttp_request* _req, bool _replySent) : req(_req), replySent(_replySent)
+HTTPRequest::HTTPRequest(struct evhttp_request* _req, bool _replySent)
+                                                                       : req(_req),
+                                                                       replySent(_replySent)
 {
 }
 
Formatting src/httpserver.cpp
diff --git a/src/httpserver.cpp b/src/httpserver.cpp
index 7282b517f4..96a525bf86 100644
--- a/src/httpserver.cpp
+++ b/src/httpserver.cpp
@@ -510,7 +510,9 @@ void HTTPEvent::trigger(struct timeval* tv)
     else
         evtimer_add(ev, tv); // trigger after timeval passed
 }
-HTTPRequest::HTTPRequest(struct evhttp_request* _req, bool _replySent) : req(_req), replySent(_replySent)
+HTTPRequest::HTTPRequest(struct evhttp_request* _req, bool _replySent)
+    : req(_req),
+      replySent(_replySent)
 {
 }
 
```

```
$ which cfd
cfd ()
{ 
    ~/workspace/btc_bitcoin_core/contrib/devtools/clang-format-diff.py -p1 -i -v
}

body: This (moving `}` from a new line to the end of the line) doesn't look like a sensible change.
Why does this include a change in `locale.cpp` in the first place?
ACK, except for the unnecessary changes.
This is just `clang-format -i` doing its work :)
C++11 allows trailing commas, so that should be preferred, imo
I really don't have any opinion TBH: I'm happy with whatever `clang-format -i` outputs :)
Maybe leave the second commit for a later fuzz pull request, so that people here can focus on the fuzz test itself for review?
